title: A. J. Langer
text:
Allison Joy Courtenay (née Langer), commonly known as A. J. Langer, is an American actress. She played Rayanne Graff on the television series "<a href="My%20So-Called%20Life">My So-Called Life</a>". Now she is the Countess of Devon.
Early years.
Allison Joy Langer was born in <a href="Columbus%2C%20Ohio">Columbus, Ohio</a>, daughter of Deana, an <a href="audiologist">audiologist</a> who owned a <a href="hearing%20aid">hearing aid</a> distribution company, and Gary Langer, who worked in sales for a wholesale <a href="fashion">fashion</a> distributor. She moved to the <a href="San%20Fernando%20Valley">San Fernando Valley</a> with her family at age five. When she joined an otherwise all-boys <a href="baseball">baseball</a> team at age eight, her teammates considered the name "Allison" to be too feminine, and began calling her by her initials, "A.J." She has one older brother, Kirk.
Career.
After recurring roles on several television shows, including "<a href="The%20Wonder%20Years">The Wonder Years</a>", "<a href="Baywatch">Baywatch</a>" and "<a href="Drexell%27s%20Class">Drexell's Class</a>", Langer was cast as Rayanne Graff on "<a href="My%20So-Called%20Life">My So-Called Life</a>". She also appeared in the cast of the sitcoms "<a href="It%27s%20Like%2C%20You%20Know...">It's Like, You Know...</a>" and "<a href="Three%20Sisters%20%28American%20TV%20series%29">Three Sisters</a>" as well as the <a href="drama">drama</a> <a href="Television%20program">series</a> "<a href="Eyes%20%28TV%20series%29">Eyes</a>". Her film appearances include <a href="John%20Carpenter">John Carpenter</a>'s "<a href="Escape%20From%20L.A.">Escape From L.A.</a>" and <a href="Wes%20Craven">Wes Craven</a>'s <a href="horror%20film">horror film</a> "<a href="The%20People%20Under%20the%20Stairs">The People Under the Stairs</a>".
In 2011, after a six-year acting hiatus, Langer appeared in 14 episodes of "<a href="Private%20Practice%20%28TV%20series%29">Private Practice</a>" in the recurring role of Erica Warner. She left the show in 2012 following the death of her character.
Personal life.
Langer married attorney <a href="Charles%20Courtenay%2C%2019th%20Earl%20of%20Devon">Charles Courtenay</a>, the son of <a href="Hugh%20Courtenay%2C%2018th%20Earl%20of%20Devon">Hugh Courtenay, 18th Earl of Devon</a>, in a <a href="civil%20ceremony">civil ceremony</a> in 2004. A formal wedding took place on April 30, 2005, in <a href="Los%20Angeles%2C%20California">Los Angeles, California</a>. Until the death of her father-in-law, Langer held the <a href="Courtesy%20titles%20in%20the%20United%20Kingdom">courtesy title</a> of Lady Courtenay. Following his death, and upon her husband's succession as 19th <a href="Earl%20of%20Devon">Earl of Devon</a>, she assumed the title of <a href="Countess">Countess</a> of Devon. In January 2014, she and her husband permanently relocated their family to <a href="London">London</a>, and to the family seat at <a href="Powderham%20Castle">Powderham Castle</a> in May 2015. The couple have two children, a daughter and a son:
In her spare time, Langer raises awareness and money for the research and treatment of <a href="fibromyalgia">fibromyalgia</a>, from which she herself suffers.
